Y9icSACi9xVvkcHFtS6XNA.text: I was incredibly disappointed with the service that I received in the afternoon Sunday, July 27.  I made reservations via an online app, and they were relatively prompt sitting us.  A slight annoyance was that they never removed my name from their list so the app kept texting me that my table was ready.  I had to go back to the hostess to change this.  Next, I was a bit annoyed that it took our server too long to greet us.  Yes they were "busy" but in my section there were a lot of empty tables.  My boyfriend and I order immediately when he greets us.  It's ~3 PM  We decide to be simple to get in and out (or so we thought).  I ordered the sliders and fries with a Blue Moon; my boyfriend ordered a turkey burger and a side of fries.  My beer came 5 minutes later (which is fine).  20 minutes come around and I ask the waiter to check on the food.  My fear is another table getting my food (sliders and burgers are common).  It's going on 3:30 PM.  I'm beginning to get restless and not to mention hungry.  The server then brings on the excuses.  "We just got a large influx of people so we're a bit swamped".  He tells me the manager will bring the food out...  10 minutes later (yep, a total of 45 minutes after we ordered) the manager (Kristopher Brown) comes out with the food.  All that he did was apologize and give me the same excuse that they're just busy.  Other people that came in before us were in and out.  He offered NOTHING to us. No discount, no complimentary anything.  We felt like we didn't matter at all and that management didn't care about us.  After that I didn't have the time to even argue.  I guess I know where I stand.  I was greatly disappointed in the service and ESPECIALLY Management.

rbWxGpoisguIJ4T4AGUUFQ.text: Came into town for the Monday night game and were else would you go for some pre- game, but to the Jerome Bettiss' Grille. Read some of the earlier reviews and got kind of nervous.  However all I can say to that is, it's a sports bar, they serve beer and it's awesome. Came in a few hours before the game hoping it would be packed and it was, Steeler nation was in the house. Lot of T.Vs to watch and a nice gated outdoor area to hang out it. Not a better place to get warmed up, ramped up, and ready for Heinz field!  Beer is cold and food is exactly what I want out of a sports bar.  Had the Bulgogi and some wings for some dinner and they were both delicious.  Bulgogi came in a flour tortilla with a wasabi slaw and a spicy Asian chili sauce.  Wings came in orders of 9, 18, and 36, so I went with 18 with the hot garlic parm sauce. With all those wings I had to drink plenty of beer to wash them down with.  The bar had my favorite on draft magic hat #9 and all six were just as good. Each one even got a little better.   Jerome Bettis Grille was exactly what I was looking for, great atmosphere, great people and great Service.  If you're looking for a fine dining experience, a quiet place to be with your friends, and a lame night probably not the place for you. If you want to rock out with some great Steelers fans then this is the place for you.

FVi_w5IZkmoj8ZRuVdf4Lw.text: Coming down from Western NY for a Monday Pirates game vs. the Braves, who I rarely get to see, my brother and I wanted to make a day of it. After doing some research of the sports bar/grills that populate the area around PNC Park and Heinz Field, Jerome Bettis' seemed like our best bet, though no place had crazy outstanding reviews. We'll let it slide that the Steelers beat our Bills just two days before!  Entering at around 3:30pm after a 3 hour drive we were seated quickly at a hi-top table in the bar. Lots of TV and we liked that they had the TVs "pre-labled" with which games would be showing on them in the evening. I had a nice view out the patio at the WWII memorial as well as the Fountain across the river. It was already pretty bustling with Pirates fans and a few of our fellow friends from Braves Country.  Toi was our waitress and was very pleasant and quick with service, even if my brother's NY Drivers License confused her when looking for his birthday :).  My brother and I both started with draft beers. They have large glasses for the $7.50 range and a wide selection of PA local and general favorites on draft.   I ordered the BBQ Pulled Pork Biscuit "Sliders" and my brother got the BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger with the sauce on the side. Our food came out very quickly and was freshly made and piping hot. I sort of had low expectations for biscuits made at a sports bar, but I have to say I was very impressed. They were warm, flaky, and held together even with the BBQ sauce. The pulled pork was moist and tender and the BBQ sauce which was layered on top was nothing out of this world, but still very tangy and a good compliment. Not too spicy or salty. There were lightly battered/fried thin onion "strings" on it. Those were a little tough. Might be better to have them chopped because they were hard to bite through. With a small side of basic fries, it was a filling meal.   My brother chowed down on the cheeseburger, dipping it in the BBQ sauce. He ordered it medium rare and said it was perfectly done. Good amount of toppings, large overall burger, and I could see the bacon sticking out of every side. Had a higher end, large soft bakery roll. He ate every little bit while hardly talking so I would consider that a success.  Prices for downtown/near stadium food are to be expected. It was $13 for my two biscuit sliders and $12 for the burger. I think mine was a little over priced for the size, but it was still good. I did like that they had quite a few fancier salads and vegetarian items. I always take note since my mom is a vegetarian and it is rare sports bar place has these, so I would recommend it here if you have a veggie eater in your group.  The bathrooms were oddly weird... my brother went when we got there and said it was "like a club". I went when we left and it was SO dark in there. I had to use my phone's flashlight app to find something in my purse. Very strange considering the rest of the restaurant is not like that.

rnSN3xEiQWlhx2PIAWBmzg.text: I am a Life long Steelers fan. So my review might be slightly jaded, but this was a great experiences (yes I specifically said experience vs just a great restaurant.). NjDOGGc16aU_U8zJ6fSLhA.text: My fiance went to Notre dame and is from Pittsburgh, so he's a big fan of everything Bettis. Once seated, I noticed the large number of TVs and how they were labeled with which hockey games they were showing.  Being from Buffalo and a huge Sabres fan, I was delighted when they changed one of the TVs to show my game.   The menu ranges from typical bar food to fairly gourmet selections.  Despite a grilled chicken option sounding very tasty, I opted for something that I highly doubt I can find anywhere else - the deep fried cheeseburger.  Am I glad I tried it?  Yes.  Would I ever have it again?  No.  It had a tempura type batter on it and it was HUGE.  Certainly a fork and knife sort of burger.  It was tasty and they burger was moist without the trimmings being soggy.  But it is very filling.    And apparently the men's bathroom has a mirror that you can see out to the bar so you don't miss any of the game action. Strange, but I guess just something else that makes Bettis's memorable.  Will I go back to Berttis's?  Sure.  I'll just be sensible and order the chicken.

nuX9Tp6O7g0cJs2dQKqOOQ.text: Received a two star because the food was excellent, but host staff is horrible.  Was visiting from out of town and thought it would be nice to visit the north shore for the Game since I've never been there before.   I have been in the food service Industry and have never seen such poorly trained Manager or Host staff. Went there on game day and put my name on the list.  After waiting for 1.5hrs I asked hostess where my name was on the list and they said they called my cell phone and i didn't answer.  I showed the hostess my cell phone log and showed her that I had NOT missed any calls, and NO calls from any numbers in PGH.  She insisted she called me and there was nothing more she could do.    There was a guy standing there and I asked him if I could talk to a manager and he said he would get one.  He left and returned and said there weren't any managers present and he couldn't find one.  BTW, while I was standing there a girl came up and said she had two missed call and showed them her phone log and they told her we gave your table away for not answering.    I asked the gentleman his name and he refused to give it to me, and said I was out of luck on getting a seat.  I asked for the manager again and voices started to elevate and he asked me to step outside so we could settle it the  old fashioned way with a fight...    Now I'm asking him, are you really threatening me because you don't want to find your manager???     Fortunately there was a patron behind me who heard the whole thing, asked if I needed a manager and left and returned in less than a minute with one.   The manager did not seem concerned that her server just threatened me and wanted to go outside, nor did she seem concerned over how the other hostesses said they called me when I didn't have any missed calls and perfectly good cell signal.  Her only comment to me was it was game day and it happens.   I have worked major Events my whole life and know the planning associated with it and can relate, but again making this statement is not fixing the problem or addressing the issue with the staff.   Fortunately as we were going through these issues another gentleman walked by and said I have your seat follow me.   Not sure why the manager or all the other staff are so poorly trained.   If They are going to use cell phones as the only source to commiunicate a seating they need to be prepared to address issues when they are wrong and accidentally cross a name off The list without contacting them.  The waiter we had was excellent and food was excellent, but this incident soured the whole experience

DyfLjhDsbPBp1C2lr0e_Vw.text: We used to enjoy this restaurant as we are season ticket holders to the Pirates and attend quite a few Steeler games also.  We have eaten here 30+ times and always had good experiences until recently.  We ate there about 2 months ago and had a extremely rude waiter who was apparently not happy that we came to the restaurant with a 2 year old and a 5 year old.  It started when we asked for a grilled cheese for our son which is not on their children's menu.  Although grilled cheese is not on the children's menu, there is a "grown up grilled cheese" on the main menu, and we had previously ordered a simple grilled cheese with American cheese on several occasions in the past for our picky 5 year old son without a problem.  The waiter immediately let us know that we could not order this as it was not on the kids menu.  Okay, we did not complain and just moved on and ordered an alternative item.  I ordered a beer that was a Sam Adam's IPA and received what was obviously a Sam Adam's ale or seasonal.  I tried to politely explain to the server that I had received the wrong beer and he was not receptive.  I ordered a second beer attempting to be very specific and again was given the same incorrect beer.  At this point point I realized I was not going to get the correct order and gave up and moved on.  At the end of the meal we were given the bill.  I asked if we were going to be offered dessert.  The server looked at the kids as if to say "did they deserve dessert".  At that point I just paid the bill.  When the server returned and in a condescending manner asked how everything was I simply said "the food was good as always but the service is usually better".  At that point we left and I did not make a scene.  I am a doctor and my wife is a lawyer and we eat a number of restaurants through business and with our children.  We are very ethical and understanding people.  This was an obvious attempt by a service employee to "put us in our place".  Maybe it was the kids being loud but I have never been treated like this in my life at anywhere from McDonalds to Ruth's Chris.   We have returned to Jerome Bettis on a few occasions and it now seems that the server remembers us and has stalked our table in an attempt to make us feel awkward.  Well it is very awkward!  We finally attempted to bring our concern to the manager who confronted the employee in question.  Obviously the employee denied this.  At this point we will not return to Jerome Bettis Grille.  This is my first review of anything in general on a public forum but I feel so offended by our treatment at this restaurant that I feel the need to voice this review.  There are plenty of good places to eat on the north shore.  Avoid Jerome Bettis Grille 36.

W0tBqpi5gZlkRpi2svVkGg.text: Atypical sports bar, big drinks, big portions of unhealthy food and a lot of flat screen televisions. Oh, big bill at the end of your meal too.   Most popular item on the menu seems to be the deep fried Italian hoagies, deep fried cheeseburgers and meatball sandwich. No, the don't deep fry the salads here, but even they aren't typically healthy due to the fact they use about a hall cup of dressing per dinner salad, and according to Pittsburgh rules, about a half pound of fries depending on your salad. The 36 oz steak is huge and looks like it would be hard to finish along with the sides and salad that comes with that meal.   Daily drink specials and happy hour priced apps. Busy during events at PNC Park and Heinz Field, and after work with all the offices on the North Shore.

UtUwZUfvLjeNmMvi_tkASA.text: Meh describes it perfectly.  Dry rub wings were pretty good but other than that everything was mediocre at best.  Service was slow considering it was less than 1/2 full.  They weren't rude but they weren't overly pleasant either.  Probably better to just go to the bar pre-game.

NuORcCrZIfVhXcmLHlGQdA.text: We went there for dinner at a gameless night. I had a steak burger and my friend had a turkey burger. The service was good, and the person serving us was very quick to attend to our needs. My burger wasn't very good. The meat was kinda dry and it was very though to chew and it didn't have a lot of flavor. My friends turkey sandwich was good.   The bathrooms are very weird. They have very little light inside.   Overall it's got a good atmosphere and its a pleasant place, and we had a good time. Too bad the food wasn't the best, but we'll be going back for another try some other time.

fUuuF8dcxVwA4Xz3MX_hAw.text: I typically wouldn't give a sports bar 5 stars, but I couldn't think of anything wrong with the place! I went at lunch and sat at the bar, and even with only one bartender, service was efficient and helpful. I didn't get a drink since I had to return to work, but I ordered the pierogi flatbread and a side of the legendary mac and cheese. It was ENTIRELY too much food, but man was it worth it! The flatbread was everything I wanted it to be - a great balance of the potato, cheese, and onion, nothing overly heavy. And the mac and cheese... a friend had mandated I get it, and I originally was going to order the entree, but she stopped me in my tracks and said the side was enough. It WAS. The richest, most decadent mac and cheese I think I've ever had! So needless to say, I left about $16 lighter and 100 lbs heavier.

F09dxzkA628MHp0DMeQCMQ.text: Was enjoying a summer day, listening to an outdoor concert at stage AE and decided to move over and sit outside of JBG and have some cocktails and appetizers with a friend. The service was wonderful, very polite host and our server was very helpful and fun. The food for the price is where I had issues. I had 3 beers (draft selection was pretty decent) but at 8$ a pop for each one (all different) was a bit much.  Food wise: started with the spinach artichoke dip...a little too creamy, but still good.  Continued on with the short rib tacos which were maybe the worse tacos of my life. cold tortilla, little meat, and dry slaw mix. nothing at all interesting and certainly not worth the like 13$. I had to put the leftover spinach artichoke dip on top to give it any moisture. still only finished 1.   So, location is great...food is meh...prices are as high, but service was wonderful. Won't be going back though

fVcRXbJOIB7j5J9RlO_Wcg.text: This place has a great gluten free menu.  Their steak/ egg/ whatever salad is amazing and their bacon burger AND FRIES!!!!!!!! is likewise delectable.  I'm always a bit impressed when a place can offer me SAFE fries.  They do have a designated gluten free menu... so you just have to ask.  I'm pretty sure everything even comes out on specially shaped plates to fully differentiate gluten from gluten free items.   Overall its a nice place to catch a game, chat with a few buddies, and eat +/- drink.  Parking might be a challenge if its a game night... but there are something like 3 lots within 2-3 blocks that you can pay a rather low rate for the night.

rxXLv1xOyAGzwPjOYoGW9g.text: Ate here on a Sunday in September to watch some football. First the service is fantastic. Our waiter worked especially hard to fill up my drinks without even asking. The men's restroom are really cool it's a one sided mirror where you can look over the whole bar. The atmosphere especially while watching the games was electric. Would really recommend this place for a lunch break or even a night out

HEGm8UniP1SkS4DN9Wl7xw.text: Slow. Slow. Slow service.  Several empty tables but the kitchen takes forever.40 mins to get wings for an appetizer. Sports vibe. OK beer selection, decent pub like fare. If you are in a hurry, go somewhere else.

s733ZjrtzcXylYEQzj2MQw.text: Very disappointing!!!! If you like to wait this is the place for you. When we got there with a party of 6, we were told 30 to 45 minutes. tMcksC36tVU6njHXkeXWyQ.text: Came here after our Heinz Field tour. The restaurant was very busy when we got there but we were seated right away. Our waitress was Toi and she absolutely wonderful. PfDQVK59lhdB_7NIZqGyhQ.text: Today was my first time at the Jerome Bettis Grill. I came to Pittsburgh from Oregon to visit family here and wanted to check out the steelers fest/regatta. I decided to stop in here for a drink, I ordered a Mojito and it was terrible! All I could taste was liquor and the flavor was awful. A mojito should be refreshing and crisp, not flat and tasting like cheap rum. I would never recommend this place for drinks, maybe the food is alright but I didn't stay long enough to find out.

nXG6dFlYMlOirnrw-LVMeQ.text: This is one of our go-to places on the North Shore. The portion sizes are huge, like what would be appropriate for The Bus himself. I recommend mortal humans share one entree and one appetizer. Unless you get the tot-choes. Those can easily feed a family (of Mormon Fundamentalists).

H9EGwRu_gXsMYG7jIouOWQ.text: Being a native of Dallas (Go Cowboys), I already had a negative perception of this Steeler restaurant.  But it won me over.  The wait on game/playoff/football weekend sucks...real bad.  But Pittsburgh loves its sport teams and I can respect that.  When you first walk into the restaurant you notice all the black and gold and TVs.  There are flat panel HDTVs everywhere you turn, which are tuned into many different sports so you won't miss anything.  As I was waiting for 1.5 hours I saw a waitress carry around a nice piece of steak.  It looked so delicious.  So I got it.  It was satisfying.    I also recommend the "house made bread pudding with sweet flakey croissants, oatmeal, and raisins" for dessert.  It is scrumptious.    I would recommend taking "The BUS" to this grill because parking in the lot across the street costs money.

wsTYGLclveVjLRfhVrvVjg.text: Zero stars. We came here for dinner last Thursday. There were four of us and there was no wait. The waitress tried to seat us at a table with only three chairs, without finding us a fourth chair. I guess one person was supposed to sit on the floor. Then we asked to move to another table, and instead of saying that was ok, she responded that would be a different server. I am not sure why we cared, except our service turned out to be terrible.  Maybe she was trying to save us from that, but I highly doubt she was thinking of us. It took us forever to get our food, and the server was not friendly at all. I ordered a grilled cheese with tomato soup. The "soup" came in a container the size of a side salad dressing. I was expecting an actual bowl of soup. The sandwich and salad dressing/soup were cold. I'm not sure if we were being punished for moving tables, or if it was always that bad. There are way better places to eat in Pittsburgh. Don't waste your hard earned money here.  This place is living off a name only. It's a tourist trap.  Bad food, even worse service.

iL6jJJWe2ua-X0LVRsih7w.text: We have been this this place twice. Once last yr and then again 8/3/19. Last yr. We came to Pittsburg for a baseball game and we put our name  and phone # in to be seated. She told us 15 mins. We waited over an hr. Because they forgot us. The waiter ended up being great and the food was as well but being forgotten and she did tell us she forgot. So fast forward 1 yr. We come again for a baseball game and this time bring our son. VrOaHiE4yEHWRxElfqU9Tg.text: We don't get into town often, and had our first opportunity to eat here tonight. George was an amazing server and had great recommendations, as well as kept us laughing. The family tried some pasta and a burger and everything was very good. Good atmosphere and lots of TVs if you want to watch some sports. Highly recommend.

JKlFcLzfczDxW5VikDyklw.text: George was amazing! The venue was packed, in that everyone was waiting for the impending Steeler game.  As soon as we were seated, we were greeted. Our drink order was taken and our appetizers placed with the kitchen. The entire visit mirrored the exceptional service and professionalism exhibited initially. We will most certainly be back.   Oh, did I mention that the food was very very good? It was!!?

VbRuRNo2MxeY8sYdNFvRjA.text: Wow.  What a disappointing meal and event.  The place was empty and we felt rushed.  My daughter and I came here before a concert at Stage AE.  We sat down and the waitress took our drink order.  She then got our meal order.  The food was ok nothing spectacular- pierogi for my kid and street taco for me.  Mine were ok at best.  The waitresses was nice and friendly but WAY to efficient.  Before our meal was finished she put our check on the table.  I mean we weren't done eating yet.  Then after she brought the check, she asked how we wanted to pay.  I never felt so rushed to get out of a place in my life.   I get it it's Jerome Bettis' place but I'm not sure it's worth the hype.

iW9E3j_V_uNoUXiphlqWsw.text: Went there on a Wednesday afternoon with 10 people. There was no one on the restaurant or bar area at all. 0lo1dMXGDsqgb1BBiCnnMg.text: We had lunch here after a tour of Heinz field. It was the perfect stop for us. It was a 5-10 minute walk from the stadium. We got there around 1pm so it was not crowded. It also has  outdoor seating.

eeCf8tmV58MZL000sYHZog.text: AWFUL!! We've been to the Bettis Grille a few times previously and had positive experiences.  Sadly, this was not one of those times.  First, the air conditioning was out.  I get it things break, you can't always control that though it didn't look like anyone was in a hurry to fix it or apologetic about it.  The men's room was filthy.  There was no soap and no indication there had been soap present in recent history.  If they can't take care of the restrooms, what else aren't they taking care of?  I told the hostess about it who gave me a "who cares?" look.  An hour later after a second visit to the men's room it still had not been refilled.  The remainder of the restaurant didn't look much cleaner.  Our group had simple orders of burgers and salads.  It took over an hour for the order to come out.  When it did finally come, the burgers were cold and looked like they had sat under the heat lamp for a while because the cheese had taken on a crusty look.  Also, the lettuce and tomato absent even thought the waitress had asked us specifically if we wanted that included.  We had to ask for silverware.  It just seems like no one in the place seems to care or have an interest in providing good service.  The whole place made me long for the more sanitary conditions of PNC Park.  This place is past its prime, go somewhere else.

7C5-PYsyqz8EN-yElMP17w.text: George is great. What a great place!  Food is delicious and service is wonderful! We will definitely come back! Ribeye was delicious. Pretzel bites were great too!

wLBqlFPsJb3Aolv71EWxfQ.text: Good service, good food, good atmosphere. Any time I go back to Pittsburgh I definitely will visit again. Our waitress was polite and timely and our food came out great and even though it was busy because it was game day we didn't have to wait too long.

Q0EnqKXat4ByPaeUQG660Q.text: I came here the Steeler game on Monday night with two of my friends. The space is nice and roomy with a lot of seating. My friends and i found a table at the bar area and sat there. I will start by saying two things: 1) our waiter came right over and asked for our drink orders (i like that) and 2) the bar area was a little busy, not definitely not completely full. He brought us back our drinks and then went on to another table. He wanted to put an app in, but our waiter never came back. Finally when he did, he brought another guy over and said that since they were so busy (they weren't) that they would both be helping us out tonight. A while later, the original waiter comes back over and says "he's taking care of you now, right? Okay good." Then ran away as fast as he came. At this time we were still waiting to put our appetizer order in. Finally about a half hour later, the second guy comes over and asks if we needed anything. (My water was empty). At that time, we put in our appetizer order, some more drink orders, and i asked for more water, because we didn't know when he'd be back. He came back about 10 minutes later with our appetizer and then about 10 minutes after that when our drink orders. A while later he came back to take our dinner orders. Two of us got salads and the third person for a turkey burger. It took almost 45 minutes for our food to arrive and was brought out by someone else. A half hour after our food came out, our waiter came back and was very anxious to give us our check. He did not check to see how our food was nor did he refill our drinks. Once he dropped off the checks, he was very quick to take our checks and bring them back. We stayed until the end of the game and he didn't come back to check on us once we cashed out. He didn't offer any more water or anything.   On top of that, the food was nothing exciting. I gave this place 2 stars because the atmosphere and warm and inviting and it is a great place to watch a game. But, i probably won't be back.

vnvrTQ3aqcSS_8oWENCzFA.text: Someone who I guess may be a manager kept the hostess staff and bartender away from customers.  Not sure if it was actually a manager. Wendell.

JYZBkW6tyPoJLCZv0yXH7w.text: Stopped in after being at Stage AE for the Sumo Showdown.  Bar area was pretty full when we arrived but we managed to get a table that was just being cleaned.   Our waitress was terrible!   We ordered drinks and one app. and stated that we would be ordering more apps. once we had our drinks.  The drinks took a little bit and our waitress disappeared before we could order more apps.  Then she did stop by and looked at us and said, Oh Yea you ordered an app.  She ran and picked up our app. and started to run away! Ha!  We were able to get her attention and did order more apps.   During all of this a few more people showed up at our table and not service. Those apps. did show up pretty soon and then she did refill some drinks and take the other drink orders.  By this time the bar area was about half full. Then no waitress, no cleaning up of all the plates and apps that were on our table, no drink refills.  We put all of the dirty plates on a table nearby.  Those were picked up and finally we were asked if we wanted drink refills.  Then we asked for the check.  She forgot that and we had to ask again about 20 minutes later. We shared a few apps and a steak salad.  The steak salad was good, the Chips & Queso was OK, you do get a fair amount of Queso and Salsa but not enough chips.  The flatbread and quesadilla were also OK.

yoqA4jc2IGduo_jzFGljnA.text: We love the aspect of all things Steelers and try to support the legend  of "the Bus". Every year we try and seems it is a fail. Service was poor in that you could not even get someone to look at you when walked in. It was a late Sunday, well after the crowds were gone. The server was to distracted to bother with our meager order of dessert and drinks.  We love you Jerome, but will break tradition and eat elsewhere.

FXgDLAq8qepdiS1A336OlA.text: Upon our first trip to Jerome Bettis' Grille 36 about three weeks ago, we left extremely disappointed. When we put in our name, the hostesses gave us no idea of how long the wait would be, but it ended up being over an hour. This wouldn't have been a problem if we didn't have to watch half the tables sit there empty, due to lack of staff. When we were finally seated, we ordered immediately. The waitress told us the food would probably take awhile. Indeed, it took about 45 minutes to finally see our entrees. The experience became extremely poor at this point, as one of the entrees was wrong. We ordered boneless wings, but received a chicken sandwich. The waitress even asked which dipping sauces we wanted upon ordering, not what we wanted on a sandwich, so the order was placed correctly by us.  When we pointed it out to the waitress, she had the nerve to tell us we put in the order incorrectly. To tell the customer they're the ones in the wrong is poor practice, especially when it's not their fault. We told her that we wanted boneless wings, so I'm not sure why she'd say it was our fault that the order didn't come out that way. Finally, she told us she'd put in an order of boneless wings for us. We then told her we had no silverware or napkins. The rest of our party that did have food had to stare at our entrees and wait for utensils to be brought over. It took the waitress ten minutes, as she went around chatting with other tables. We ended up asking another employee for the silverware, so we could eat before the food was completely cold. When the waitress finally did come back, she came with cocktail napkins and no silverware. The person in our party waiting for the wings finally got to eat as we were signing the bill. After signing, we were given the receipt of another party. Although they did charge us for the correct order, I ended up having to leave with no receipt, as the waitress was nowhere to be found. The next day, I sent an email explaining all of this, in hopes that management would work on training their employees to be kinder and more attentive. I received no response. It appears they don't place very much importance on customer service. We won't be returning.

ztPdguEMh26VIrZm7DQkgw.text: This was on our list of places to try in Pittsburgh, I'm glad we did!  The service was great, atmosphere was fun, food was amazing.  Our table was very sticky, which was a big turn off, but the dining area was clean and the food and service made up for the sticky table. The four of us had a pierogi flatbread, spinach and artichoke dip, kids mac and cheese with fruit, and a barnyard burger.  The portions were huge, we could have shared a couple items.  The kids mac was delicious, everyone tried it and the kid still had more than he could eat.  First, I have to say that I was impressed that every kids meal came with one side.  Most places only certain items get a side, and typically the macaroni and cheese is not one of those items.  The fruit cup wowed me, actual fresh fruit!  Watermelon, cantaloupe, grapes, and blueberries- a 'cup of soup' size bowl.  The spinach and artichoke dip was a generous portion with both tortilla chips and pita bread slices.  The teenager barely put a dent in it but she was busy picking off of everyone else's plate!  The pierogi flatbread was so delicious, and a unique combination.  Just the right amount of food to feel very full but not overly stuffed.  The barnyard burger was a great burger and when given a choice of fries or tots, the hubby couldn't decide so he got both.  He definitely liked the tots better, but didn't get to eat many between the two kids!  This is a great place to go and we will be back!

eFH9_GKrXPziGBwc2r_u3Q.text: We had an okay experience here. Our server was nice, but we didn't stay long. Looking at the menu, there was lots to pick from, but in the past, we've only really had satisfactory experiences with the food. For this reason, we decided to not order food but stick with drinks.   We were seated outside and it was a beautiful day. Upon entering, we were told we would have to wait 20 minutes for a table outside, but it was more like 20 seconds, which was nice. The beer menu didn't have prices on it, so that was a little inconvenient. The cheapest special they had for the holiday weekend was $4 Miller. We each drank a beer and left, due to this. It was a nice atmosphere and good service, but if you're looking for good, reasonably priced drinks and food specials, this is not the spot. Although, I'd stop back for Happy hour, if that makes a difference.

pWoNEuWtv9B_iWYtmJGI_g.text: So I was at a yoga class with my close personal friend, Snooki, from TV's "Jersey Shore".    While doing a Warrior One pose, she whispers to me "You know, it's really fun to take a leak in public".  Knowing how conservative and middle-aged I am, I figured she was just trying to get me to blush so I told her to zip it.  Of course if she could do  that, she wouldn't be pregnant now!  Fast forward to lunch on a sunny Saturday at Jerome Bettis' Grille 36....I visit the men's room and lo and behold, they've got this one way mirror in front of the urinals so you're facing the bar while taking a leak!  You can see people right outside but they can't see you (at least I hope not).   That was a very freaky experience, but I can see where Snooki was coming from...it was kind of cool.  Now, onto the food.  My friend and I sat on the patio. It was sunny and we weren't under a tree so it got pretty hot with no shade.   We started with the soft pretzel sticks.  They were great!  Then my friend had the mac and cheese and I had the meat lover's flat bread.  He liked his food and mine was tasty, although if the flatbread had been crispier, it would have been nearly perfect.  Our server was like a Pittsburgh version of Matthew McConaughey.  He was laid back to the point of being in a coma and I could barely understand a word that he mumbled.  But he was nice, our drinks were never empty and he got us our food, so there you go.  The decor is really nice and everyone there was friendly.  I don't think it's fine dining, but for solid food and nice service, I would recommend this place.

fzmZQfGzB6R_JJyelcfTyQ.text: What this place has going for it is it's location-right across the street from Heinz Field.  Other than that, I would be hard pressed to go out of my way to eat here.  Every single person at my table had the same opinion of the food: it was nothing special.  I had the Burger 36, and with its blend of sirloin, short rib meat and bacon it sounded pretty good.  But it was less flavorful that I expected.   Our waitress was exceptional, but I did notice other tables not getting as good service as we did.  Looking at the other Yelp reviews, I would think fair to middling service was the norm, and our good service was not the norm.  One particular aspect of the restaurant might entice someone to downgrade or upgrade the restaurant rating by one star:  the men's room.  Behind the hostess table is a mirror.  When you enter the very dark men's room right behind it you realize the mirror is actually a one-way mirror over the men's urinals.  One member of our party was weirded out by the fact he was peeing while looking out at people entering the restaurant.  One other member of our party liked that he could pee and watch the football game mounted at the entrance.  To each his own, but I was ambivalent and used the stall.

6_-MU6H8dU0_rPDiXruwgQ.text: Even though I'm not a football fan (sorry!), I ended up having the greatest lunch here.  Whatever you do, start with the pretzels! They were out of this world. Enough said. Just do it.  I went for the Sesame Ginger chicken salad, and I don't regret it. A little spicy, a little juicy and a bunch of green goodies - this lunch was exactly what I wanted. Would not mind going here for dinner, I'd love to try out some of the beers they have here. There is a lot to choose from.   The whole place was neat and clean (restrooms, too), pretty good for a sportsbar! It left me impressed.

oWq-z9xWtODEWkDkKU57yA.text: Service is fine, food is good but the wait time both to sit and to get your food is absolutely ridiculous. We waited 45 minutes to sit and ordered our food as soon as we sat down because we had 3 hungry kids. We ordered 2 kids Mac and cheese, a kids sandwich, a Greek salad and a pulled pork sandwich. It took ONE HOUR, 10 MINUTES for our food to come out. We asked our server about our food twice and while she was friendly, her response was, "It's coming". I can't imagine coming back with kids- maybe if my husband and I want to kill 2 hours to eat lunch.

E-cOAAC2_h96HYepchQjqA.text: My family and I ate dinner here on 12/27/16 and the service was slow and took forever.  When our dinners arrived, my daughter's mashed potatoes were cold.  The blackened mahi mahi sandwich I ordered was missing the cheese I requested and when the waiter took it back, the chef slapped a piece of cheese on the fish and it didn't even melt.  When we spoke to the waiter about it, nothing was done.   We were very displeased with the food and service during this outing.  Not sure if we will return again.

X5QK4bZvD3N3I-s5nuV3eA.text: It was my first visit. I enjoyed it. Very good service from drinks to dinner. Didn't have to wait long, they weren't exactly busy though. The food I did order was very good the "TOT"- chips were nice and crispy and the toppings were amazing. Also I ordered a Sesame chicken salad, very delicious. They only thing I wasn't okay with was the price. I think you're paying for "Jerome Bettis" rather than the quality of the meal. I would return.

ZXk6FbJmCaZq5PJxnYTYzA.text: Me and boyfriend came here after watching some of the pirates game. The people at the front desk were super friendly. We were seated quickly. The food I had was the bbq pulled pork sandwich and it was really delicious. I also had sweet potato fries with caramel dipping sauce which our server Shelly recommended us to try. It was a great combination. She was very kind and personable. It made the overall experience awesome. Next time I'm in the Pittsburgh area I'll definitely return.

84PqOPfZlm3FCjViDW1rCQ.text: Stopped here before Pirates game. First time here and will be the last. From entering we got an attitude greeter that just was arrogant,maybe he was having a bad day. Very dirty floors with food and napkins all over the place. He sat us with menus and we waited and waited and finally a server who was not ours came over and asked what we wanted to drink,2 waters an ice tea and a beer. Our actual waitress came with 1 water 1 ice tea and the beer. I asked for my water as she asked us for an app order.We ordered the nachos. She came back in a few minutes and we put in 2 burgers and an order of wings. Few minutes went by and the nachos came and they was pretty good. Then we waited for about 45 minutes and they kept saying the kitchen is a little messed up but we noticed that people who say after us had gotten their food already so we asked a few minutes later and still no food. Manager came over and used the kitchen excuse and asked what they could do for us. We said just bring out our food. Finally came and was defiantly not worth the wait. Burgers had a taste of dirty grill and just bland. The tots I got were just not very good. They gave us some money off as they seen we didn't eat most of it and told us please come back and try again. Pretty sure we won't.

xwGwoC3BhbWeKM7jwjgsKw.text: The place was pretty busy as a Pirates game had just ended.   Our food arrived quickly and was pretty good. We had TOTchos (tater tot nachos). I had the Bettis burger, slightly small for the price, and fries.The bun was twice the size of the burger and the fries were meh. My husband got the fish and chips but substituted the chips for mac n cheese. The fish was great. The mac n cheese was basically a full meal on its own but was incredibly heavy.  I'd return if we were in the area but wouldn't make a special trip.

XgNCQp1WnMnnU3qURQGtZA.text: Back again, whoops.  We are staying at a nearby hotel, figured we would come here for drinks and dessert.  Waited 40 mins, which I really didn't care about then when we were the last party waiting, host staff asked what we were doing.  I said waiting, of course.  They said we were notified of outlet table earlier so I showed them my phone.  Apparently we could have seated much sooner but we weren't sent any notification.  Whatever.  Ordered a cocktail with Maker's.  It was not awesome, served in a plastic cup, probably a total of 4oz of liquid - $14.  Wife's drink was similar, $10 and not worth it either.  Last visit to the Bettis Grille.

NqYZvcjmWJb74Kwe-nAeaQ.text: So we are in Pittsburgh for the Easter weekend. Staying down the street from Heinz stadium.  After our stadium tour, we decided to eat here.  Nice day out so we asked to sit outside.  It wasn't terribly busy. No line or ppl waiting, however the hostess was completely overwhelmed.  Ok so we get sat outside.  The table was wobbly and took about ten minutes for a server to come over.  Such chaos!  Food runners were bringing food to wrong tables...it was terrible.  We finally got our appetizer firecracker shrimp (after it was almost pawned off to three other tables)-it was amazing.   We ran out of drinks halfway through the appetizer---and then our food finally came after they thought they already served it to us.  It was cold!  Our waitress finally brought my husband a beer, it was the wrong one.  I got up two times to refill my water myself.  Really really poor experience!

axvrkO2DtCsgsAbL3fBLpQ.text: This is the only restaurant in the city I can eat in and not worry about gluten contamination! They have wings, French fries, tots all fried up in a dedicated fryer. As usual, make sure to let your server or bartender aware of your gluten intolerance and watch for your food to be served on a circle plate. They even carry Omission beer. The food is good as well as the service.

1fbPPIJAnY9ansR3mYf-ew.text: We went there for our sons birthday dinner. It was our first time there. The manager made us feel like we was the only people in the restaurant even though they was extremely busy. Food was great and our waiter was on top of everything. I can't wait to go back!

2-14rznfk_ikBZUa7ewM6g.text: Went to this restaurant with a group of 4. While I can't recall our waiters name, he was excellent!! He took the time to go over the menu with us, checked in on us often and had an awesome sense of humor. He also provided dessert for my friends birthday. The food took a little while longer than expected, but they were very busy. In the end the meal was delicious and well worth the wait. Will go again next time we go to Pittsburgh!

25FsAfww9yqCXLEp041_6Q.text: I'm never coming here again. I am writing this as we are here. We are a large group at a high table in the bar area. We told the server that we would take care of her because we would be here all evening to watch the STANLEY CUP FINAL. She barely showed up. Service was so bad, we gave up on her and just ordered from the bar.   The absolute worst part, though, is the DJ. They have the TV volume turned off when the puck is not in play, and instead some idiot DJ who clearly has never watched a single game of hockey is blathering on and on, reminding us that we are watching the Penguins play a game. A lot of people were expressing their displeasure over the fact that we couldn't hear any of the pregame commentary. One of our party found a manager and asked that they put the TV volume on, and the answer he got was, "We turn off the DJ when the puck drops. That's just how we do it here." Idiots. Idiots. Idiots. They are absolutely killing the atmosphere.   I thought this place was annoying during football games with the DJ coming on during every commercial, but this is beyond the pale. Seriously, never again. If I could give zero stars, I would.

jRqDKmnlbHDAKAYjS0coQA.text: Went in tonight with my family for the first time since we're visiting from Albuquerque, New Mexico and my dad is a diehard Steeler fan! We all ordered the Steeler's Steak and they all came out perfect! Our server Mike, was attentive and kept our drinks full! One of the managers (Jason) came up to the table after we'd finished and was SO amazing! He gave us a list of places to go while we're here, told us a little about the history and even took us into the Owner's Box so we could see Jerome's hangout and the shoes that he wore while playing! It was great and we will definitely be back on Sunday before the game while ESPN is there! Hopefully lucky enough to meet/see Jerome!

K68fmX9rDvbAnTsbl4bTpA.text: If you want to have an amazing eating and beverage experience you need to head to the Jerome Bettis Bar and Grill. Especially on game day for the Steelers. The service provided by Mike was top-notch. You have to eat the deep fried cheeseburger- it is to die for!!  And the special attention/suggestions regarding tourist attractions that Jason provided was also truly appreciated.  Taking time to go to the Bettis Bar and Grill is an absolute must. Go Steelers.

l409_k8Ws8wIRqcoTvbYaA.text: Great location, traffic can be a hassle even if not a game day. Had the wings in the signature black and gold sauce. They were delicious and I would get them again. The rest of the family enjoyed their meal. If your in the area definitely stop by.

NuTsR4b1lopF5c-2lUQR7w.text: Great drink menu, great food. Good specials. Bartenders are super friendly! Have been there a few times and have always had a great experience. Lots of memorabilia to check out which makes it a great environment for the interested sports fan. All of their TVs indicate the games that will be played on them for the day too, so you can seat yourself accordingly. Love it!

qQof9HL2VivBJYOOPAVh8A.text: We went here before a concert at Stage AE and for once we didn't have to wait. We usually go somewhere else, because it's always an hour or more wait.   We aren't Steelers fans, in fact we both had on New England Patriots clothes. The staff was very nice and told us it was a great Super Bowl and everyone has their own team. Very nice, because it's True, doesn't matter where you live, you can like any team.  We ordered our food, got burgers and the food came out in a timely manner and everything was very good. Our server was good too.  The servers walked around and cleaned up the floor in our area all night and kept the dinning area very clean.  My only complaint, I went to the bathroom before we left for the concert, it looked like a tornado happened in there! Toilet paper everywhere, half the stalls didn't have toilet paper, or the new rolls where sitting on the dirty bathroom floor! The trash can was overflowing and paper towels were all over the floor. It was just a VERY dirty bathroom. There are enough hostess outside of the bathroom, standing at the desk, that someone could check the bathroom. I was a hostess before and I checked the bathrooms on busy nights every hour!

QhoVFqbLYwrGxBG-52ezPg.text: Food is gross! Pulled pork sandwich was so dry it tasted like what I would expect dirt to taste like. Wanted to order tortilla soup, the waitress said "it's gross today, don't bother", service was horrible and she brought our check before I finished 1/2 of my meal.

5i9zWB9Vh_in6T2ZPjee-g.text: We love Jerome so I was so glad when this restaurant turned out to be so good!  The Black Bean Burger and Salmon, Rice and Veggies were legendary. Oh, they aren't kidding when they tell you the Carrot Cake is big enough for two, 2 Pittsburgh Steelers!  It was big enough for our entire table of 7!  And Maggie was a great waitress. We will be back!

CYi2BybMTlqQoJ4sVKK_8Q.text: This was a disappointment. And, our expectations weren't that high to begin with. We didn't want a fancy steakhouse just a decent place with decent food where we could get a steak. Service was OK. But the space itself was filthy--food, napkins and even silverware all over the floor. Food was not good. Atmosphere was flat, not inviting. Overall recommendation--don't do it.

gQjcfl5mdL6wfxWiqlt8HA.text: We arrived around 4:30 on a Saturday afternoon. We were told it would be 30 minutes for a table so we sat at the bar to have a drink. Bartender was very welcoming. He immediately acknowledged us and had menus in hand. My wife ordered a cocktail (a mule of some sort). She loved it, and she is very particular about her cocktails. I went with a Guinness cause you can't go wrong with that. Within ten minutes, I received a text notifying us our table was ready. We were seated outside on the patio with a wonderful view of The Point. Our table was in the sun and we were hot so we were about to ask if we could move to another table with shade. The manager could tell we were in need of assistance and came over to introduce himself (Eugene). What a gentleman! He escorted us to the other table and proceeded to take our order himself. He explained that they had an unexpected surge and so staffing levels weren't what would be ideal. Well we couldn't tell. Eugene  made us feel like VIPS. He tended to every detail of our visit. Eugene did what a lot of managers don't do in a tight situation - he rolled up his sleeves and helped his staff. Now to the meal. I ordered the deep fried cheeseburger which was deep fried deliciousness. I had a second Guinness as well and my wife ordered a second cocktail which she enjoyed as much as the first. We had a top notch experience and we will definitely be back again.

3tTK-HLFZN69i3iAEPWKlQ.text: You're probably thinking how have you lived in Pittsburgh forever and never been here?  I don't know but I know I'll be back.   We went on a Sunday night when it was dead after the March Madness events in Pittsburgh blew over.  If you're gonna watch sports in Pittsburgh this would be a good option to do it.  TVs are at every angle and I mean EVERY ANGLE, even in the booths.  That was another highlight, huge divided privacy booths big enough for 4 with 6 people's worth of room. Fast, friendly service from our waiter Niko kept the mood perfect.  A large beer/wine selection upped the odds of leaving tipsy.  We ordered the loaded nachos for the appetizer and we loved them.  Enough for 4 people.  For entrees we got the sliders and salmon.  I don't think the food was mind blowing but it was fresh, hot and full of flavor, adequate.  Afterwards we sat and the bar and had a few more drinks because at this point we were highly satisfied with the pace and efficiency of the night.  I'll have to go back on a busy night and see if the execution is the same, but from our first go through I'll say I look forward to going back.  Maybe even get the 36 ounce steak!

_CNw-k4Oe5qxd8x3DX0LfQ.text: I have visited this establishment probably 3 or 4 times over the course of 5 years. Out of those times I've ordered food only once and the other times I was just stopping in before a game to grab a beer. As far as the food goes it was awhile ago but I remember getting the deep fried Italian sub. I think mostly it actually being breaded and deep friend was about the coolest thing about it. Other than that it wasn't anything that great tasting. As far as stoping in here before a game and grabbing a beer I would AVOID this place. I usually only get drug in here because the people I'm with want to stop in and check it out. I know most places around this area especially at game time get busy but this place is not worth your time during a game day. I wouldn't even stop in just to look around as it gets so packed you can barely even move around in the place. The last time I stoped in 10/22/17 was the first time I actually got very rude service from the bartender. You could tell he was overwhelmed by the number of people ordering drinks but there is no reason to  be disrespect to paying customers with a bad attitude. Also if you don't like waiting for 20 plus minutes just to get you and your buddies a quick beer definitely don't try this place. The Tilted Kilt that is pretty much so next door is the place I would recommend 100 times over this place on a game day. They keep things rolling over there and there bartenders slay drink orders left and right. The only time I would give grille 36 another shot would be during a week day but I'll never be out there to try it for that seeing as I'm only in that area for Steeler games.

I can't get too in depth on things here since I had chicken strips while sitting at the bar.  It was packed for a Thursday happy hour, good, kinda loud music playing. Not too loud though. Decent selection of beer on draft and plenty of seating, probably not enough before a Steelers game though.  I gave it 4 stars because the beer was cold and the service was quick. And the chicken was pretty good. Will be back sometime to actually hang out and eat a meal.

NLtrijI-0WmOImYv-47GNg.text: A little disappointed. Specifically called earlier in the week to ask if they had the SEC network. The person who answered the phone asked if I meant college football, I said yes but that it was the specific network channel I was asking about to watch a game. Was told yes, they can show all games. Got there tonight and asked for an SEC network game to be put on, and was told that "Once the TVs are on something, they can't be changed."  Mind you, we were two of four people currently in the bar area at 7:45pm on a Saturday. The bartender then said she could check on it. Came back saying they couldn't get it, we questioned if they didn't have the channel, or if they just couldn't put it on one of the TVs, was told a vague answer of "yeah, we can't, but sometimes the satellites get messed up." We ordered, on tap drinks were good, mixed drinks not great; food was okay, nothing to rave about and took a while to get for not being very crowded. Waitstaff was attentive, but not necessarily friendly, and there were a lot of them just congregating around talking to each other. When we left, two employees were outside the front door smoking. Have been before and definitely seems like service has gone down hill.

9K09YsI9rpQm8bkkXsAkfg.text: We always stop here when we pass through Pittsburgh. Today, our server, George, was wonderful!  The patio has beautiful views of the river and a great atmosphere.  We had the sesame chicken salad and apple gorgonzola salad.  Both delicious choices for a summer afternoon lunch.  We can never pass up the boneless buffalo wings and they get better every time we visit!

No wonder it was empty there service sucks! Then an hour passed our waiter disappeared and I had to ask another waiter for our food because my one year old was soo hungry like come on! So our food was brought but it was wrong and I had it! Wanted to talk to the manager and ask to talk to him he never showed up! yqnOxfPqO3TkS0NNthj6uA.text: Could not have had a better experience than we did at Jerome Bettis' Grille tonight. My friend and I were walking her dog along the North Shore and wanted to grab a drink somewhere. When we walked by, we asked the servers outside if we could bring our dog and they were so friendly and welcoming and made sure the dog was taken care of and brought water for him. The service was so great all around. We did go there later in the evening on a Friday night, but it wasn't even that busy and all the servers were so attentive to their tables and made time to connect with each of them (not in an annoying way) and have good conversations. Our server, Gabriel was fabulous and so engaging, he made great recommendations and hooked us up. The whole staff was phenomenal. My friend and I split the bill and Gabriel accidentally ran my card for both. We didn't realize until after the fact but just decided my friend would Venmo me her portion. A few minutes later the manager proactively came out and apologized for what happened and asked if she could fix it for us. It was honestly no big deal and something my friend and I could take care of our end but we definitely appreciated the offer and the desire to solve the problem without us even having to bring it to their attention. We had such a great night all around but a big shout out to Jerome Bettis' Grille for being the highlight.

W-KKf59lps_L0rpffrk4eg.text: Went there today after the Pirates baseball game. Ordered the wings appetizer. They were slathered in gooey BBQ sauce to make up for the extremely dry chicken. The chips & queso tasted like the chips were purchased from the 99 cent store. Stale and tasteless. The queso was thick and gooey instead of creamy. My brother-in-law ordered a 2nd beer that took 15 minutes to arrive. I ordered a refill for my Diet Pepsi and she brought it back without ice (??). My sesame chicken salad was fairly good, but the dressing was too thick, sour/tangy and tasted store bought. We ordered a dessert to share at the table among the four of us, but we couldn't pass the dessert around because the server never removed our finished plates from the table. We had to stack them high in the center of the table. The server was nice, but did not seem very well trained. I would not recommend this place at all.

TTKkqWqMpuxCO526Vrk5rQ.text: My boyfriend and I came here for the first time today for our 1.5 yr anniversary and we brought our puppy, and it was AMAZING. The staff was great with our dog! Everyone was so friendly especially our waiter George! He was very prompt, friendly, knowledgeable and GREAT with our puppy. Brought him water and ice frequently! As a young couple about to relocate to Pittsburgh, this was the experience we needed. We would highly recommend this place to everyone and anyone! Can't wait to move here and come back!!

oGiZXAzBn2_EBcQPrMa51A.text: Food was pretty good - we had the farmhouse burger, kielbasa, and street tacos. RYgv92MLX1v6Fo4rDKdPnQ.text: Was there for lunch before the Phillies game on Sunday July 21. Food was great and the server George was outstanding I would definitely recommend this place

1EeBO8iA-IYODMJsUvVfCA.text: Before I review the restaurant and experience, I want to give a special shout out to our waiter, George. George is perhaps the friendliest waiter I've ever had the pleasure of having. He was kind, attentive, and had a wonderful sense of humor. Despite being extremely busy and waiting many, many tables, he still found time to not only take a few minutes to talk to us, but also to leave a hand-written note on our bill. George, if you read this, thank you again for the wonderful evening of service!!!  Where to begin? Grille 36 has always been a favorite of mine, but I don't often get down there because the parking situation on the North Shore is always a big tenuous. As my girlfriend had never been there and as we were both in the mood for sandwiches from somewhere different, we decided to brave the Pitt game day parking situation and give it a shot.  We were seated within minutes of arriving even though it was busy, which I thought was excellent as it was clear there were many people watching the second half of the game and lingering. Our server, as stated above, was wonderful from beginning to end and was probably the best we've ever had.   I ordered the BBQ Bacon burger, which was cooked perfectly and had a wonderful blend of flavors. The fries were also excellent. My girlfriend had the Blackened Fish sandwich and she was very pleasantly surprised as well.   We also took George's advice and tried the deep fried pretzels, which were one of the better appetizers we've had while eating out. The queso and mustard dipping sauces were very flavorful.   We topped off our dinner with a slice of the carrot cake, which was enormous. We split it in half and still ended up with some to take home!   You get a lot of value for what you pay and the selection is quite wide. We'll definitely be back!

377k1upAdXpqEE0COKGKAw.text: Complete disappontment.. SLOW service, often empty soft-drink glasses, not impressed with the rib-eye (lots of grissle), desserts meh.  Several cabernets on the list, out of all, and they offered  Menage-a-Trois instead, wow... Party of 9, literally two and one-half hours (over half the place was completely empty), and one worker, no joke, commented when we noticed that one dessert was flat and half the size of the other two said, "I just work here". Jerome may have been the BUS on the field, but his joint is a flat tire in my book...

RFtKJrrak7dv5J2W0TPcTQ.text: Great service great location great cocktails     We were enjoying a warm afternoon on the north shore one Sunday and stopped for lunch. The drink menu might have more items on it than the food menu. I tried one called something like "watermelon wave". It was refreshing and not overly sweet...perfect!    I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich for lunch and it was well seasoned...flavorful and delicious. The fries were pretty darn good too.   Although we arrived at the restaurant during an unexpected rush, we sat outside and didn't mind the wait. We could see the fountain at the Point and a newlywed couple and their bridal party were taking photos in the nearby park so we just sat back and enjoyed a beautiful day in Pittsburgh.

OaTXMu8dweYkuW8UkOLWWw.text: Early lunch on a Sunday. Ordered the slider appetizers and a small side salad. The salad was excellent. Nice variety of mixed greens and a tangy honey mustard. Mlx9-0AIjnv6ycbtjpoyOg.text: Stopped in for dinner for a bachelor party before going out. The food was average, nothing extraordinary. We ordered tatchos as an appetizer and they were the best part of the meal. I ordered the black and bleu burger and ordered it medium; it came out extra well done and was very dry.   I ordered a bourbon smash and it came out in a tiny plastic cup. When I got it, the cup was only 3/4 of the way full and there was a ton of ice. What really was disappointing was they charged me $14 for a sub par drink!!  The service was very slow. It took over an hour for our appetizers to come out (tatchos, quesadilla, and a buffalo chicken flatbread). We were at the restaurant for over 2.5 hours because it took another 50 minutes for our meals to come out after our appetizers. Very disappointing.  I probably wouldn't return in the future, but if I did, I would try either the artery clogging fried cheeseburger or fried Italian hoagie.

isE4q1iXvZOSv2JwKls58w.text: I'm going to bed hungry tonight because we choose to have dinner at Jerome Bettis' Grille 36. So we went there on Saturday night before the Steelers -Chiefs game. It was a present to our 19 yr old son for his birthday. He really wanted to go and I looked at the menu and gave it a thumbs up. We got there at 6:30 (to be fair, remember, Saturday night before a big game) and they said it would be a 90 min wait. Okay, our son really wanted to eat there. We were seated at 8:15. We ordered the nachos and my wife wanted one of their appetizer Bloody Mary's. They were both excellent, the Bloody Mary was served with 4 garlic shrimp that had a lot of taste. The nachos were 8 inches high and were some of the better ones that I have had. Jalepenos, olives, a lite cheese sauce, and a tasty ground beef. Yum. Before they came, we all ordered burgers, let's say about 8:30-40. At 9:30, our embarrassed waitress came back and said that there had been a meltdown in the kitchen. I'm a reasonable guy, I said "just bring us good food, and all is well". Three burgers, fries and that's it. The manager came over in the meantime and bared his soul that he didn't know why this was happening, but it was obvious that we were about the fifth table he had spoken with and he'd had enough too. By 10:00 we had had enough.  No burgers in site. Our waitress did her best to keep us there and actually paid for the food and drink that we had. I couldn't let that happen, and gave her cash for the food and drink consumed. I also gave her a healthy tip because this wasn't her fault. It was actually her that suggested the YELP review because Jerome and management read them.   So here is your message. Great concept. Really good wait staff help. Questionable management, and some of the worst execution that I've seen. 4 hours and no entree?  Unacceptable. I'm not going back. I don't want a coupon or a phone call. I'm reviewing this to tell you if you execute like this, you won't have a business. Save yourself.

We all started off with drinks - margaritas, mojitos, mixed drinks and drafts! The appetizers were great, especially the nachos! For our meals, a few people had the southwest club, that they said was delicious! I had the Black and Bleu burger and it was great! I would definitely go back and like to try the deep fried hoagie. We did order one of their specialty cocktails also and enjoyed it too.  I'd love to come back during football season. I imagine this would be a great place to watch the game.

zzrmRpS6JeRR-O9X_gKY0w.text: On Wednesday I was part of a group of 12 Penn State wrestling fans that was here for an early dinner. They were very accommodating and the food and service was great. George and Clara were our servers and did a fantastic job. I will definitely be back and strongly recommend this place!!!

IhFIVI54oPueO1l0e2qyxA.text: I should have known something was wrong when the restaurant was locked and the host had to come and let us in, in the middle of the day.  A co-worker and I went there for lunch. We sat down, got our drinks and menus right away. We put in our order fairly quickly, but then proceeded to wait for 40 minutes for our food. I got mine right away, but the server told my co-worker that they didn't have what he ordered.  They didn't tell us in the time that we waited that the grill was down and it was an extremely limited menu. He requested the menu again and proceeded to eat his side salad. After waiting 10 minutes for the menu he decided not to get anything else because he didn't want to wait another 40 minutes and be late.   Other tables were also quite upset with service. Another individual ordered steak rare, but came out burnt to a crisp. Another table ordered appetizers shortly after we sat down, and did not receive them until after we got our entrees. Not only that, they ordered the sliders, and were not told that they were unavailable due to the grill being down until after they received their wings as apps.   Never once did the servers ever seem to care or try to improve their attitudes. I would have been understanding with the grill being limited as long as we were told ahead of time, or if they actually seemed to care about the us.  After waiting another 20 minutes for refills and the check, we finally left and will not be returning.

lAX9i6DVJP69GHvy0NO4KQ.text: So disappointing how bad the service was!  We went to Bettis Grill 36 on 7/7/18 for a nice afternoon on the patio overlooking the river since the weather was fantastic.  The place was empty which was surprising but then we understood why...  We were sat on the patio as requested and it took 15 minutes (not exaggerating) for a waitress to acknowledge we were there.  It took another 10 minutes for our two beers to be brought to us.  It was unbelievable how slow she was.  While we had our drink and looked at the menus, one of the servers across the patio yelled at a group of customers who moved an umbrella to block the sun.  That was enough for us, we closed our tab and went across the street to Tequila Cowboy and had a great afternoon!  Sad to see Bettis' go so far downhill.  Best location in Pittsburgh but that alone won't get it.

neY7tLTzrDEKFX3Qwhra6w.text: First time at Grille 36 and the food was great and a great place to watch sports. Our server George gave us plenty of great recommendations and was a great server! I'll definitely be coming back to this place for food and drinks!

1WZldThGva7On1nhWDS9-g.text: Delicious food. Great variety. Best location when going to a gMe. Service a little slow.

C_01mpHxUkLw7lyDVvvQjg.text: We were in town and wanting to watch his Jets and my Steelers, so we thought Bettis' would give us a good mix of "being with the crowd" actually attending a game, and "being able to watch on TV." We were correct in that regard, though the TVs were a little on the small side. I'm spoiled though, so I didn't actually complain about that or anything. Just something I noted. Being as it was game day we got there early, and despite being told there was a 2 hour wait, were seated within 10 minutes (our first drink at the bar hadn't even been poured yet.) I'm sure it's hard to guess whether a group is staying for the whole game or just trying to eat before heading to the game, so that was sort of understandable.  I started with a mimosa, and then found out they were $8....and since they were served in a plastic 5oz water cup....not exactly worth it. We opted for the Miller Light $4 special instead. We shared a pile of wings, and the spinach/artichoke dip. The dip was one of the better ones I've had, and even though I'm not typically a pork belly person, it definitely added a little something something. The wings were good too, definitely meaty! We tried black and gold BBQ and Hot Buffalo. Whoo! That was hot. For serious.  Overall, it's good people watching and sports watching, especially on game day, but there are a few things that could be improved upon (like the mimosa situation.) They had fun raffles and whatnot throughout the game too which was fun.

eGkSBy04py0qobV0ehLwGA.text: Great place to visit of you're a Steelers fan! awesome vibe from all the people, wouldn't recommend the food.
